alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 11:44AM PST until February 23 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Low Elevation Snow Monday night through Tuesday night... .A cold weather system will bring moderate to locally heavy amounts of snow to the west slopes of the Sierra Nevada. Lowering snow levels on Tuesday may bring a dusting of snow down to around 1000 feet. Lighter amounts of snow are forecast for areas north of Sierra County. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches above 4000 feet, with localized amounts up to 18 inches over the peaks. For the Motherlode 1 to 4 inches of snow between 2000 and 3000 feet are expected. Lowering snow levels on Tuesday may bring a dusting of snow down to around 1000 feet. * WHERE...Motherlode and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada. * WHEN...4 PM Monday to 4 AM Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibilities at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
